location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.112 of 1855 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to an act of piracy committed against a Bahraini vessel in the coastal waters between Aboothabee [Abu Dhabi] and Ras Reccan [Ra’s Rakan], as reported by the Native Agent at Sharjah, Hajjī Yaqoob. Kemball writes that subsequent efforts to find the perpetrators have thus far proved unsuccessful, and that he will despatch the Tigristo the Arab coast to seek the help of the region’s rulers in the search. Two enclosures follow Kemball’s letter:1. The translation of a letter (folio 75-76) from Hajee Yacoob [Hajjī Yaqoob] to Kemball, dated 6 January 1855, containing details of the act of piracy;2. Letter no.111 of 1855 (folio 77) from Kemball to Lieutenant Alexander Foulerton, Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf, dated 12 April 1855.
